China.  causing at least nine
people to die.
Local police said the
accident occurred in cold weather
and slippery road conditions. More than 100
cars collided consecutively and caused a
chaotic scene on the highway.  Three
injured victims were transported to the
hospital while six others suffered only
minor injuries. Currently, the police are
investigating the cause of the incident while the
road where the accident occurred has been
reopened to traffic.  As

decorated
with colorful lanterns to celebrate the
lantern festival, also known as the
Lantern Festival, is a traditional festival
in China held on the
15th day of the year.  The first month of the lunar calendar
is also the time that marks the end of the
New Year festival. Chinese people often
celebrate the lantern festival by going
outdoors to see many types of feather lanterns
with different colors and shapes.
Made by folk artists from bamboo,
rattan straw wood or any material they can
apply, this year is the year of Giap thuong so the

depicting the nuances of
this mascot even though  It was very cold but we
still came here to see the brilliant lanterns.
The tradition of hanging lanterns in
China dates back thousands of years and is deeply
rooted in Chinese culture. Lanterns are a
symbol of brightness and reunion.
prosperity, so people like to hang lights
both indoors and outdoors, especially
in the lunar month to pray for a
good start to the new year. The
